page.title: 14Kimbolton - Farming
page.content: The typical farm in this block is about 300 acres in size;is a family business employing one or two at most;is rented from Boots Pension Fund;is given over to the growing of winter wheat and barley,and oilseed rape. In fact though,four of the eight farms are privately owned.The field sizes are between 20 and 60 acres and well-suited to the use of large machinery.The soil is fertile medium clay loam,much of it classified Grade 2 by the Ministry of Agriculture.Common Market policies over the last few years have brought farmers a good living.Another crop is trees,mostly hardwoods. After some years of neglect by the estate recent fellings have been replaced by young plantations and the landscape still appears comparatively denuded.
